ratings.comment: One of the nicest people- she really wants her students to learn and was extremely flexible with deadlines. After a lot of students didn't do well on the first exam, the ones following that were 10x easier. As a non-business student, I struggled a bit, but I did still really enjoy this class. Did have to pay $50 for a textbook we barely used though

Prof Neumayer is the best professor I've had!! She's so caring and really wants to make sure that her students succeed. I took this class with her during COVID so it was all online and she was very understanding and flexible. 10/10
Super disorganized, horrible!! Not understanding during covid at all, do not take this class with her.
I took both Spanish 204 and Spanish 311 with Kristin. Shes the most caring professor that you'll ever meet. She inspired me to continue taking Spanish.

Kristin is a happy, understanding person but not a great professor. She is very unorganized so you never know when assignments are due or what you're actually supposed to be doing. The class had no objective really, we mostly just looked at different websites for Spanish companies. Take this course abroad if you can.

Kristin is a great prof. She is very considerate and the class is easy and informative. My only complaint is that you don't speak much Spanish if at all in class. Most of the work is reading, essays, and small easy quizzes.

I took this class online during the 4 week summer term. Kristin is clearly passionate about teaching and very open to helping you with any questions you have. Her feedback on essays was sometimes too vague, so I would have to email her about a few comments which was sometimes annoying. Put in the work and you'll do well!

Kind & inspirational professor. Really cares about her students and wants you to succeed. Homework was online but you need the book for in-class activities. Lots of participation required and there are texts every chapter that aren't too bad. She prepares you well and tells you what to expect. Also gives you feedback on writings to correct for pts.

I absolutely loved having Kristin. She is so understanding and truly believes in helping her students to actually LEARN spanish and not just memorize. She gives great feedback and allows students to revise assignments for additional credit! Would definitely take again!

Kristin is a nice change from other vigorous classes at UW-Madison - she doesn't want her students to be too stressed and is very understanding. Class is composed of mini online homework assignments that are easy, chapter quizzes (MC and short answer), audio recordings, etc. Pay attention in class and this class is an easy A.

I contacted this professor to opt to take the final exam early due to an illness in the family and she would not allow me to do so. Im now in the position to either fail my final exam and go to tend to my sick relative or stay to take the exam and spend my entire winter break alone. Will definitely not be taking a course with this professor again.

I really loved having Spanish 311 with Kristin! She makes the course extremely low stress, as you can revise almost every exercise you do (although make sure to look them over thoroughly before turning them in) and she gives you a week or more to finish a majority of the assignments. My only complaint is that we didn't speak a lot in this class.

Kristin is probably the kindest professor in the department. Since this course is geared toward Spanish certificates in the business school, it is not very "advanced". Kristin wants her students to learn and enjoy it, not necessarily to assign a ton of back-breaking work. This class was insightful and fun, mostly due to her enthusiasm.

Kristin was my favorite professor so far at UW.  I did not enjoy my 226 class, but 311 with Kristin reminded me why I enjoy Spanish.   You go to class, work on homework together as a class, go home and type out the homework, and turn that in.  You do three SHORT (less than one page) papers and there are revisions on everything. I LOVED this class!

Neumayer was a very friendly and easy to approach teacher. There was very little homework and no exams. Most of the graded work was through in-class homework exercises and essays. Although she was a pretty easy, I feel like I wasn't challenged enough and didn't learn that much spanish for a 300 level.

Kristin rocks! Given that this was business Spanish, she didn't want this class to be hard. She just wanted us to show up and participate, so we did. Quiz every other week, one presentation, one SHORT final paper (2 pages). Majority of grade was completing homework quizzes on L@UW: often tech glitches, but after emailing her shefixed them quickly.

Kristin is awesome! Very easy class. Homework was worth 60% of the grade, so as long as you do that and do decently well on the quizzes, you should be fine. Easy grader. Relaxed atmosphere. Would take again.

I loved having Professor Neumayer for Spanish 311. She is extremely friendly and approachable, tries to make class interesting, and grades fairly. I found that having in-class essays to be nice because there is less work outside of the classroom. Had no trouble getting a good grade.

Prof. Neumayer is without a doubt one of the nicest, sweetest ladies I have ever met. She legitimately wants to make sure everyone understands the material and is taking something away from her class. You'll love her, I promise.
I love Kristin! She cares so much about our understanding and will always explain things. Very easy class, hardly even had to attend to get an A.

She is the best Spanish professor I've had over the 4 years at UW! Very nice and genuinely wants everyone to improve. She doesn't compare you to the other students and helps improve everyone's speaking fluency.
Best teacher in the school

She is the best spanish teacher I have had here at UW! She is so nice and wants everyone to do well. Organizes the class so it isn't hard and you actually learn the material. Open note tests, no final, tells you line numbers from the text to find answers for homework questions. If I have the opportunity I will take another of her classes.

Kristin's a nice person but her grading makes no sense. She takes off if you write too much, she takes off if you leave out insignificant bits of information. She takes off for not putting titles in quotes on FILL IN THE BLANKS. I've taken tons of lit classes & consistently get A's, but even after talking to her I have no idea what I'm doing wrong.

Neumayer is one of the best Spanish teachers I have had here at UW. She is kind,truthful and is a great spanish speaker. 224 could be a dull class but she makes it come alive~which is great! 3 tests (open note), read some interesting spanish poetry/stories that are good! If you can, take NEUMAYER for 311 or 224- you will not be dissappointed you di

Sra. Neumayer is absolutely amazing. She is probably one of the sweetest and nicest professors on this campus and GENUINELY wants you to do well!! While she does take a lot of small points off on your homework, you're allowed to re-do all of it AND it really helps you understand your errors. TAKE HER!! amazing!

Sra. Neumayer is the best 311 teacher in my opinion. No tests (3 in-class freewriting essays) and very minimal homework, but she teaches you real things that come up in your everyday life and makes you actually want to learn it. This was my favorite class so far.

She is extremely nice and wants you to succeed.  However, you will have to work hard in her class if you expect to do well.  Her class is deceivingly tough but it is possible to get an A if you go to her office hours and try your hardest.  I would definitely take her again.
Fun!
kristin is so helpful and really tries to make class interesting.
I loved her- she is awesome, super sweet, and makes classes fun!!  I would highly recommend taking a class from her!
She was nice but often merciless in her grading.

I love Spanish, and Sra Neumayer is probably the sweetest woman you will ever meet and will help you with anything at any time.  It's deceiving because her tests are IMPOSSIBLE and she takes off points and 1/2 points for every tiny little error, including capitalization.  Be careful!
